tool.name: Subtype Cell Detection
tool.command:
Rscript ${__tool_directory__}/single_cell_analysis.R --input1 $geneexpression --input2 0 --input3 0
--input4 #if $SpecScore.spec in ["1"]: $SpecScore.specscore #else $SpecScore.typematrix
#end if
--input5
2
--input6 #if $Disturb.disturbcode in ["1"]: $Disturb.disturb #else 0
#end if
--input7 $cpu --input8 $Decomposition.decompose
#if $Decomposition.decompose in ["4"]: --input9 $Decomposition.am --input10 $Decomposition.pm #else --input9 0 --input10 0 #end if
--input11 $SpecScore.spec
--pdf1 $tsne --output1 $celltype ;

param.name: decompose
param.label: Decomposition
param.option: Upload own amplitude matrix and pattern matrix

param.name: spec
param.label: Spec score
param.option: Calculated from known cell types matrix

param.name: typematrix
param.label: Known cell type prepared gene expression matrix used for calculating Spec score

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does**
This function is used to identity cell type of the unknown single-cell RNA-Seq samples.
-------------
.. class:: infomark
**Inputs**
* **Gene expression matrix**: Gene count matrix of the single cell.
.. csv-table:: :header: " ", "AAGATGTTTTAA", "CCTCACCGATAA", "CAATCGTTTGTG" :widths: 15, 10, 10, 10
"AT1G01010", 118, 36, 7 "AT1G01020", 5, 2, 3 "AT1G01030", 0, 0, 0 "AT1G01040", 1, 2, 1
|
* **Decomposition options**: Currently, easyMF provides three algorithms to decompose gene expression matrix including **PCA**, **ICA**, and **NMF**. In addition, easyMF supports users upload own amplitude matrix and pattern matrix.
* **Spec score**: Spec score of the known type of tissues:
.. csv-table:: :header: " ", "Atrichoblast", "Columella", "Cortex", "Endodermis" :widths: 15, 10, 10, 10, 10
"ORF25", 0, 0.127, 0, 0 "AT2G26550", 0, 0, 0, 0 "AT2G26570", 0, 0, 0.102, 0.591 "PSBA", 0, 0, 0.105, 0.105
|
* **Threads**: The cpu number to parallelly compute
For **Disturb options**, whether disturb genes should be filtered, default is **No**, if **Yes**, the **disturb genes** should be input:
+-------------+ | Disturb | +=============+ | AT2G26390 | +-------------+ | AT2G26400 | +-------------+ | AT2G26530 | +-------------+ | AT2G41640 | +-------------+
|
-------------
.. class:: infomark
**Outputs**
* **Single cell type visulization**
.. image:: static/singlecell1.jpg :width: 300 px :scale: 100 % :align: center
.. image:: static/singlecell2.jpg :width: 300 px :scale: 100 % :align: center
|
* **Identity cell type**: The identification of the unknown single cell samples:
.. csv-table:: :header: "cell_name", "type" :widths: 15, 10
"AAGATGTTTTAA", Trichoblast "CCTCACCGATAA", Trichoblast "GCGTTTGCCCTC", Cortext "AACCTGGTATTG", Atrichoblast
|
-------------
.. class:: warningmark
**Note**
* The **Gene expression matrix** should't be processed through the function **MATRIX PREPARATION**, since all the samples are need to be identified.
|
